solution_line_template: In a week, Cindy spends an average of {total_weekly_hours} hours/week / {num_courses} courses = {hours_per_course_per_week} hours/week for 1 math course.

In a month, 1 math course is {hours_per_course_per_week} hours/week x {weeks_per_month} weeks/month = <<{hours_per_course_per_week}*{weeks_per_month}={hours_per_course_per_month}>>{hours_per_course_per_month} hours.

Therefore, she earns ${hourly_rate}/hour x {hours_per_course_per_month} hours/week = $<<{hourly_rate}*{hours_per_course_per_month}={monthly_earnings_per_course}>>{monthly_earnings_per_course} a month for 1 math course.
